required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Venlafaxine ER in Children and Adolescents With Social Anxiety Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group, Flexible-Dose Study of Venlafaxine ER In Children and Adolescent Outpatients With Social Anxiety Disorder

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: To determine the anxiolytic efficacy, safety, and tolerability of a flexible-dose of venlafaxine extended release (ER) administered for 16 weeks in the treatment of children and adolescent outpatients with social anxiety disorder (generalized) in a placebo-controlled study.

primary_outcome.measure: Final on therapy Social Anxiety Scale-Adolescents and Children (SAS-AC) total score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Response, defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or (very improved), on the Clinical Global Impressions-Improvement (CGI-I) scale; Final on therapy Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale for Children and Adolescents (LSAS-AC) total score.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female outpatient
- 8-17 year old
- diagnosis of Social Anxiety Disorder
Exclusion Criteria:
- concomitant psychiatric or medical disorders which interfere with safety or assessment

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer
